snippet: The strengthening currency prompted whip-saw trading in Japanese shares on Tuesday and adds to pressure on Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, who will outline new economic policies on Wednesday.
abstract: Japan's strengthening yen prompts whip-saw trading in Japanese shares and adds to pressure on Prime Min Shinzo Abe, who is poised to outline new economic policies.
lead_paragraph: The strengthening currency prompted whip-saw trading in Japanese shares on Tuesday and adds to pressure on Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, who will outline new economic policies on Wednesday.

headline.seo: Yen Falls Against the Dollar as the Rally Ebbs
headline.main: Yen Below 100 Per Dollar, Again, in Challenge for Abe
headline.print_headline: Yen Falls Past A Milestone As the Rally In Japan Ebbs
